snippet: The European Union met in Luxembourg on Monday to discuss the disasters as rescuers scrambled to find survivors after ships sank Saturday and early Sunday.
abstract: European foreign ministers meet in Luxembourg to consider how to respond after estimates that as many as 900 migrants might have died off Libyan coast; crisis has prompted calls to reconsider approach to surge of refugees from Middle East and Africa; European leaders must grapple with growing anti-immigrant sentiment and balance humanitarian responsibilities with budget constraints.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Gaia Pianigiani from Rome, Dan Bilefsky from London, Niki Kitsantonis from Athens, David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo, and Suliman Ali Zway from Tripoli, Libya.

lead_paragraph: The European Union met in Luxembourg on Monday to discuss the disasters as rescuers scrambled to find survivors after ships sank Saturday and early Sunday.

headline.main: Rising Toll on Migrants Leaves Europe in Crisis; 900 May Be Dead at Sea
headline.print_headline: Rising Toll on Migrants Leaves Europe in Crisis; 900 May Be Dead at Sea

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
